description:
### Set of rules to enforce spelling on API titles, summaries, and descriptions

This style guide is based on the [nspell](https://github.com/wooorm/nspell) external service. Review this library before enabling this style guide. 

#### Use the spell-check rule

1. Go to your Stoplight workspace.
2. Create a [style guide project](https://meta.stoplight.io/docs/platform/364e30f79daa0-create-a-style-guide) OR edit a project that has an API.
3. Select **Manage Style Guides**.
4. Enable **Spell Check** from the list of public style guides.
5. Review the rule, and then:

    - Use the style guide as-is to [automatically check spelling for the title, summaries, and descriptions](https://meta.stoplight.io/docs/platform/7975f76a794c4-validation-and-linting) your API files
    - [Disable the rule](https://meta.stoplight.io/docs/platform/3f80fd36750e3-disable-inherited-rules) so you can customize it for your organization
    - [Duplicate the rule](https://meta.stoplight.io/docs/platform/2331c5241ddfc) and customize it to meet your needs

#### Add words to the ignore list

1. Disable the rule that you want to add ignore words to.
2. Duplicate the rule, and then set its status to `information`, `hint`, `warning`, or `error`.
3. In the **Then** section of the Rule Editor, select **+Add** to add words that should be ignored.

> JSON and APIs are added as default ignore words.

spell-check.description:
`description`, `title`, or `summary` property contains a misspelled word. If the spelling is correct, contact your API owner to add words to the `ignore` list.

**Invalid Example**

The Info description contains a misspelling (ToDo).

```yaml lineNumbers
info:
  ...
  ...
  description: The ToDo API provides a simple way for people to manage their tasks and plan their day.
```

**Valid Example**

The Info description does not contain misspellings.

```yaml lineNumbers
info:
  ...
  ...
  description: The To-do API provides a simple way for people to manage their tasks and plan their day.
```
